definition: to let emotions affect one's decisions
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: Because he's aware of his ignorance, he doesn't act with foolish confidence.
sentences.chinese: 因为他能认识到自己的无知，不会不懂装懂意气用事。

sentences.english: I think this is just people being very judgmental.
sentences.chinese: 我想人们只是意气用事罢了。

definition: to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
rude and impetuous
hot-headed/impulsive/reckless
cavalier/offhand/reckless
variant of 魯莽|鲁莽[lu3 mang3]
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
excessive tendency to clemency (idiom)/soft-hearted (pejorative)
to fail to see the larger issue (idiom)/to fail to grasp the big picture
to get angry
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
to persist in one's views
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to get angry
